titleStmt.title: Andrew Monroe and Charles M. Thruston, Affidavit
CWG2494

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: We Andrew Monroe and Ch M Thruston duly authorized to compare the Poll Books for the County of Jefferson do certify that, at an election held in the 2d District composed of the 3' & 4' Wards of the city of Louisville in said county on the 4' day of May 1861. P. A. N. Bradley Received one hundred and Sixty votes in said District for the office of Justice of the Peace in and for Jefferson County there being no votes cast for any other person for said office to fill the vacancy of George Morris Esq resigned

Ch M Thruston clk
Jeff Co Ky
There was a vacancy in the office but no writ of election had issued

Andrew Monroe
Judge Jefferson Co Court
